sub_title: Senior Manager Rail at Mott MacDonald
summary:
Professional with over 30 years international experience in transport field with focus on railway policy, R&D and engineering consultancy.
Senior Manager Rail at Mott McDonald.
Member of the Council of the Institution of Railway Signal Engineers (IRSE).
Member of the former Horizon 2020 Transport Advisory Group  of the European Commission.
Technical advisor to Federal Public Services (Mobility and Transport) in Belgium and to Jaspers facility of the European Investment Bank.
Various advisory and audit projects in The Netherlands, Denmark, Australia, Austria, Canada and in Slovenia. 
Expert of the European Commission  for review and evaluation of the transportation projects and proposals under R&D framework programs (FP / Horizon 2020/Shift2Rail) and TEN-T / CEF projects.
Between 2001-2014 business development manager within Dutch Movares group. 
2006-2012 active as statutory manager of two Polish railway engineering companies. 
Managing and co-ordinating  advisory and technical projects in Slovenia, Latvia, Slovakia and Poland.
Between 1991 and 2001 technical and strategic adviser at European Rail Research Institute, co-ordinating and managing several research projects in the area of safe railway infrastructure. 
Technical M Sc education. European Engineer (EUR ING). Managerial skills acquired via MBA studies and post MBA strategic leadership academy.
Multilingual working environment. Author of technical articles and publications.
Fellow of IRSE (Institution of Railway Signal Engineers (UK)); 
Member of German newspaper Signal + Draht advisory council; 

Practical experience: 
Policy assessments: impact analysis, ex-ante analysis.
Managerial; strategy development and implementation, finance, organization, M&A, company & project management, overall leadership, business development.
Technical: multidisciplinary railway infrastructure R&D, planning, engineering and  approval; railway systems including ETCS, interlockings and level crossing solutions.

projects:
[{'title': 'Review of investments in railway safety systems including ETCS on the Belgian railway network', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'description': 'Mott MacDonald civity, an integrated team of Mott MacDonald and civity Management Consultants, has been appointed by the Belgian Federal Ministry of Mobility and Transport, Federal Public Services (FPS) to review the investment programme for rolling out modern railway safety systems including the European Train Control System (ETCS) on the country’s conventional and high speed rail network, and to effect knowledge transfer to the FPS for auditing and programme management monitoring. 

Infrabel, the Belgian railway infrastructure manager, has developed a Masterplan to implement ETCS across Belgium’s entire rail network by 2022 and similarly the national train operating company, SNCB/NMBS, has developed a Migration Plan for migrating their fleet to ETCS standards. 

Phase 1 of the appointment (to June 2015) involves analysing the paradigm for ETCS migration, reviewing investments for signalling safety systems including ETCS, identifying and recommending possible alternatives and optimisations and carrying out a socio-economic cost benefit analysis. The programme management dynamics of Infrabel, SNCB/NMBS and FPS will also be investigated. Phase 2 (for about 7 years) centres on full knowledge transfer to FPS and includes follow-up audits and recommendations for effective programme management auditing and monitoring of the ongoing railway safety systems roll-out.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Bogdan', 'last_name': 'Godziejewski', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Senior Manager Rail at Mott MacDonald'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jan', 'last_name': 'Swanepoel', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Senior Consultant: Integration Management'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Joost', 'last_name': 'Bolck', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Divisional Director Netherlands'}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Heiner Bente', 'headline': None}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Frank Zschoche', 'headline': None}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Konstantin Meermann', 'headline': None}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Rob te Pas FIRSE', 'headline': None}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Jan Oonincx HonFIRSE', 'headline': None}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Remko Blokpoel', 'headline': None}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Oskar Stalder', 'headline': None}]}]
